oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Owner-reported Incidence of Clinical Salmonellosis in Northeastern Dairy Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rosa, B. V.
Warnick, L. D.
Cripps, C. J.
Nydam, D. V.
Reed, K. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bovine salmonellosis
zoonotic
clinical effects
herd size
housing type
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine salmonellosis is important because of clinical effects and zoonotic potential. Our objectives were to determine the frequency of owner-reported salmonellosis in northeastern US dairy herds and to examine the relationship of salmonellosis with herd size and housing type.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 296
